messages.message: Is it the drop down at the top :slightly_smiling_face:
I like it but its weird because its showing different results to me:
First time i noticed this discrepancy
Ah, that's because you don't have admin access to JPMC (and that organizations view is primarily for getting you to the admin page), but you are shared on JPMC, maybe as just a member
The Organizations view in Launcher only shows orgs you have admin access for
Oh interesting never knew that was the case
Yeah, so a normal user at one of our clients wouldn't see the Organizations menu item at all
Should Organizations move out of Launcher if the selector will be in the drop-down now?
Yes, that will happen in a future ticket, but right now if I took it out there'd be no way to get there
hm — maybe that’s too early of a thought — take that with a grain of salt
Next step is getting the Settings App up and running with everything that's currently in settings, and after that I'll be able to move Org stuff into that app and out of Launcher

oh ok — trying to wrap my head around the navigation. It’s tricky since there is a mix of Org-scoped items User-level scoped items (site-wide). Not exactly sure the right way to organize. We allow people to switch between them quite easily — perhaps we make it more intentional? Just stream of consciousness at this point :slightly_smiling_face: — feel free to ignore
Yeah it's definitely not ideal right now. Organizations will go away, and then Bookmarks will also get some UX changes to make it work better with the org-level scoping

I am terrible at scoping out small PRs so I'm trying to be more deliberate this time and not get into a state where I need to make all the changes at once haha. But if there are things you think I can start taking out/changing now that fit with the current stage, I can work those in!

All good with the incremental approach and seeing it progress over a series of PRs! Helpful to know we are an intermediate state, and the overall direction you are going in makes a lot of sense to me!
